chapter.title: Migration from &lxc; to libvirt-lxc
chapter.para: Since &sls; 12, &lxc; is integrated into &libvirt; library. This decision has several advantages over using &lxc; as a separate solution—such as a unified approach with other virtualization solutions or independence on the kernel used. This chapter describes steps needed to migrate an existing &lxc; environment for use with the &libvirt; library.

sect1.title: Host Migration
sect1.para: The migration itself has two phases. You first need to migrate the host, then the &lxc; containers. After that, you will be able to run the original containers as &vmguest;s in the &libvirt; environment.

step.para: Upgrade the host to &sls; 12 using the official DVD media.
After the upgrade, install the libvirt-daemon-lxc and libvirt-daemon-config-network packages.

sect1.title: Container Migration
sect1.para: After the host is migrated, the &lxc; container in &libvirt; will not boot. It needs to be migrated to &sls; 12 as well in order to get everything working.
